meanings.definition: Of or relating to a single clone of cells.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the monoclonal cells under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The monoclonal treatment targeted a specific type of cancer cells.
meanings.sent3: The monoclonal cells in the lab all wore tiny matching hats.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to her work was as focused and precise as a monoclonal beam of light.
meanings.sent5: The monoclonal nature of the organism made it stand out among the rest.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to or derived from a single clone of cells.
meanings.sent1: The monoclonal antibodies were designed to attack a particular virus.
meanings.sent2: The lab used monoclonal technology to produce identical cells for research.
meanings.sent3: The monoclonal clones in the experiment all had the same favorite color.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were as clear and identical as a set of monoclonal twins.
meanings.sent5: The monoclonal origin of the sample was crucial for accurate results.
